svg.style: font-family: 'Helvetica Neue', Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 18px; background-color: white; text-rendering: optimizeLegibility; -webkit-font-smoothing: antialiased;

text.tspan: Dietary land use vs. beef consumption, 2011
The percentage of global habitable land area needed for agriculture if the total world population was to adopt the
average diet of any given country versus annual per capita beef consumption, measured in kilograms per year. We
currently use approximately 50% of habitable land for agriculture, as shown by the grey horizontal line.
Source: Food Balance Sheets - FAO (2017), HALF Index (Land Use) - Alexander et al. (2016)
